bibl.title: George Hawkins v. The United States of America. Commitment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court for the Districk of Alaska, Division 2

div1.ab: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF ALASKA, SECOND DIVISION.

THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA Plaintiff,
-vs-
GEORGE ALLEN, GEORGE HAWKINS and THOMAS DOLAN,
Defendants.
div1.p:
TO THE WARDEN OF THE UNITED STATES PENITENTIARY AT McNEIL'S ISLAND, STATE OF WASHINGTON, OR HIS DEPUTY,
GREETING:

An indictment having been heretofore and on the 22nd day of January, A.D.1901, duly presented in open Court charging the defendant, George Hawkins, jointly indicted with George Allen and Thomas Dolan, with the crime of "Robbery," committed as follows:

"George Allen, George Hawkins and Thomas Dolan are accused by the Grand Jury of the District of Alaska, Division Number Two, by this indictment, of the crime of Robbery, committed as follows: The said George Allen, George Hawkins and Thomas Dolan on the 21st day of December, A.D.1900, in the District aforesaid, did wrongfully unlawfully and feloneously, take, steal, and carry away from the person of R.J.Embleton, and against his will and by force and violence to his person, the following described personal property, namely: one piece of paper money of the Dominion of Canada of the denomination and value of One Hundred Dollars; two pieces of paper money of the Domion of Canada each of the denomination and value of Fifty Dollars; four pieces of paper money of the Dominion of Canada each of the denomination and value of Twenty Dollars; one piece of paper money of the Dominion of Canada of the denomination and value of Ten Dollars, a more particular description of each or any of said pieces of paper money, aforesaid, being to the Grand Jury unknown; also, one gold watch of the value of Seventy-Five Dollars; all the personal property of the said R.J.Embleton, contrary to the form of the statute in such case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the United States.
"Dated at N ome in the District aforesaid the 22nd day of January, nineteen hundred and one.
Witnesses examined before the Grand Jury: R. J. Embleton L. C. Cherry A. J. Cody W. F. Hobbs F. Farnsworth B.H. Dittmer Fred Liebe"

And the said defendant George Hawkins having thereafter and on the 25th day of January, A.D.1901, duly appeared in open Court in person and by his attorney, James E.Fenton, for arraignment, and having thereupon been duly arraigned in open Court, and having thereupon, through his attorney, asked to have until January 28th in which to plead to the indictment; and the said defendant George Hawkins having thereafter and on the 28th day of January, A.D., 1901, appeared in open Court in person, and by his attorney, and entered a plea of "Nor Guilty" to said indictment; and the trial of said defendant upon said indictment having thereafter and on the 7th day of February, A.D., 1901, and the said defendant George Hawkins having thereafter and on the 18th day of February, A.D.,1901, been duly placed on trial in open Court upon said indictment before a jury of twelve good, fee and lawful men, and the said jury having thereafter and on the 21st day of February, A.D.,1901, come into open Court and returned a verdict against the said defendant, George Hawkins, of "Guilty of Robbery as charged in the indictment," in words and figures as follows:

"UNITED STATES vs. GEORGE ALLEN, GEORGE HAWKINS AND THOMAS FOLAN.
We, the jury impaneled in the case of the United States vs. George Hawkins, find the defendant George Hawkins guilty of the crime of Robbery as charged in the indictment."
E.S. Harrison, Foreman.

And the Court having thereupon remanded for sentence the said defendant George Hawkins to the custody of the United States Marshal for the District of Alaska, Second Division thereof, until the 22nd day of March, A.D., 1901, and the said defendant George Hawkins having thereafter and on the 22nd day of March, A.D.,1901, duly appeared in open Court for sentence, it was thereupon
ORDERED, ADJUDGED AND DECREED by the Court that the said

defendant George Hawkins is guilty of the crime of Robbery as charged in the said indictment and that the said defendant George Hawkins be imprisoned in the United States Pentitentiary at McNeil's Island at the State of Washington for a period of fifteen (15) years from noon of this 22nd day of March, A.D., 1901, and that he remain imprisoned in said pentitentiary until discharged by law, and that he be remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal for the said District of Alaska, Second Division thereof, to see that the above sentence is carried into effect.

THIS IS, THEREFORE, TO COMMAND YOU, the said Warden of the United States Pentitentiary at McNeil's Island at the State of Washington, or your deputy, to receive the said defendant George Hawkins into your custody in said penitentiary and detain him there under the above sentence and judgment of this Court until discharged by law.
DATED at Nome in said District and Division this 22nd day of March, A.D., 1901.

Endorsed: 49 Crim. Original. In the United States District Court for the District of Alaska, Second Division. United States of America vs. George Allen, George Hawkins and Thomas Dolan. Commitment of George Hawkins.
Filed in the U.S.District Court District of Alaska, Second Division, July 13, 1901, Geo.V.Berchsenius, Clerk, H.C.Gordon. Deputy. Recorded Vol.1 P.333.
